bullets: • Certain cancer cells use a low-level activation of a DNA-dismantling enzyme to survive treatment

• Because the mechanism is non-genetic, it appears much earlier than typical resistance mutations
• Targeting this enzyme could help stop tumors from returning

items.title: New research reveals how everyday cues secretly shape your habits
bullets: • A shift in a key brain protein can accelerate habit formation by amplifying dopamine-driven learning signals
• When this protein drops, dopamine neurons fire more intensely, strengthening new associations in ways that resemble how addictive behaviors take hold
• This process helps determine whether the brain responds to signals that lead to positive behaviors or ignores cues tied to harmful habits

• Traditional pay TV companies also contributed to the growth by bundling its services with streaming subscriptions

items.title: Oldest evidence of human fire-making unearthed in Britain
bullets: • Oldest evidence of human fire-making unearthed in Britain
• New study suggests humans were deliberately starting and using fires more than 400,000 years ago
• Early humans depended on nature to start one, like lightning striking a tree
• Archaeologists believe that humans and our ancestors have used fire for more than a million years

items.title: A dead whale shows up on your beach. What do you do with the 40-ton carcass?
bullets: • When a whale dies, its body descends to the bottom of the deep sea in a transformative phenomenon called a whale fall
• An estimated 20,000 whales are fatally hit each year; sometimes a ship captain rolls into harbor unaware a 40-ton body is draped across their bow
• Mass whale deaths have been linked to marine heatwaves and the toxic algae blooms that follow

items.title: What to know about death cap mushrooms, blamed for poisonings in California
bullets: • Death cap mushrooms are known to grow in many parts of California, fueled especially by the fall and winter rain

• One person was killed and three required liver transplants, but all survived

items.title: Drinking water contaminated with Pfas probably increases risk of infant mortality, study finds
bullets: • First-of-its-kind University of Arizona research found drinking well water down gradient from a Pfas-contaminated site was tied to an increase in infant mortality of 191%, pre-term birth of 20%, and low-weight birth of 43%
• The cost of complying with current regulations for removing Pfas in drinking water is estimated at about $3.8bn

• It delivers an adjustable 0.5–6Nm of torque, strong enough for assembling electronics, putting together furniture, and handling most small home repairs

items.title: Google is building an experimental new browser and a new kind of web app

• Google is launching both as experiments in the Search Labs today
